citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Amanda Frick, GIS Coordinator, Amanda Frick
citeinfo.title: Deepwater Coral HAPC - Cape Lookout Lophelia Banks (polygon)

descript.abstract: These data represent the geographic area described in Title 50 CFR Part 622.224 (c)(1)(i), Fisheries of the Caribbean, Gulf of Mexico, and South Atlantic, Subpart K— Coral, Coral Reefs, and Live/Hard Bottom Habitats of the South Atlantic Region, Area closures to protect South Atlantic corals, Deepwater coral HAPCs, Locations, Cape Lookout Lophelia Banks as of 07/17/2015.
descript.purpose: The purpose of these data is to visually represent the seasonal and/or area closures for GIS analysis and display. This does not necessarily reflect the latest information contained in the Code of Federal Regulations. Users must assume responsibility to determine the appropriate use of these data as the currency and/or accuracy of these data cannot be guaranteed.

idinfo.useconst: NOT FOR LEGAL USE. Users be advised that the accuracy of this dataset is somewhat dependent upon the accuracy of the state/federal marine boundary and EEZ data if it was used in the data creation process. For more details on this process, see the process description. The current text description from Title 50 Part 622, Fisheries of the Caribbean, Gulf of Mexico, and South Atlantic, is always the one, true definition of the seasonal and/or area closures. These, or any other depictions, are for information purposes only and shouldn't be relied on for regulatory purposes.

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.0.4322

dataqual.logic: No tests for logical consistency were performed on this data. The data was visually inspected to confirm that: it contains the requisite points and boundaries from the CFR text description; and the inside and outside of the polygons are where they should be.

horizpa.horizpar: No specific test was performed on the dataset. For the state/federal marine boundary and EEZ lines, obtained from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's National Ocean Service, the data is a reflection of the largest scale raster nautical charts of the area. The number of decimal places used in the output format does not imply an accuracy level higher than the source chart documents. The positional point data from Title 50 CFR Part 622 is accurate to the distance published in that source, varying by closed area, from one second to one minute of latitude or longitude.

citeinfo.origin: Code of Federal Regulations, Office of the Federal Register, National Archives and Records Administration
citeinfo.title: Title 50 CFR Part 622

srcinfo.srccontr: geographic locations of closed and/or managed areas.

procstep.procdesc: Points were entered in a table from geographic locations in Title 50 CFR Part 622, and a point GIS layer was created.

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)

procstep.procdesc: Created polygons of the closed areas using ESRI software from the points generated in the previous process step. If the closed area shared a border with the EEZ, or state/federal marine boundary, the EEZ or state water shapefile was combined with the geographic area described in Title 50 CFR Part 622 to complete polygon.

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)

procstep.procdesc: Rule was updated July 2015 with new coordinates.

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)
